Takes what could be an overly cute and sentimental romance (based on Dostoyevsky's story) and turns it into an amusing and very touching road movie with one of Woody's most beautiful shots as Victor Chaplin pulls the car up to the windswept villa on top of a hill.

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was originally a novel of the same title. The film version is written and directed by Bertrand Blier and I think one of the best films ever in his career. I know I enjoy the film with its crazy and silly idea written by Blier himself.
